sources.name: NASA - Five Millennium Catalog (Solar & Lunar)
sources.notes: Canonical historical/future eclipse tables and plate maps. Best source for shadow path data to seed precomputed engine.

sources.name: JPL Horizons (SSD API)
sources.notes: High-precision ephemerides for Sun/Moon/planets. Use for precise contact times & corrections at given geo locations.

sources.name: USNO Astronomical Applications API
sources.notes: Provides solar/lunar positions, rise/set times and other almanac data. Useful for validation and local-event corrections.

sources.name: NOAA SWPC - Space Weather
sources.notes: Real-time Kp index and solar storm alerts for aurora/visibility and geomagnetic conditions.

sources.name: OpenWeather One Call / Weather
sources.notes: Cloud cover & hourly forecasts for visibility scoring. Requires API key and rate-limit planning.

sources.name: Timeanddate.com - Developer APIs
sources.notes: Convenient endpoints for local times, sunrise/sunset, moon/sun positions and eclipse listings (commercial tiers).

sources.name: ESA SWE - Space Weather Services
sources.notes: Alternative/backup for space weather products and forecasts.

sources.name: Stellarium (star catalogs & assets)
sources.notes: Star catalogs & formats ideal for sky simulation / AR star overlays.

sources.name: Visual Crossing Weather
sources.notes: Alternative weather provider with global historical & forecast data, easy bulk querying.

notes: Use NASA / JPL / USNO for scientific core data. Use NOAA/ESA for space weather. Use OpenWeather or VisualCrossing for clouds/visibility. timeanddate for local convenience endpoints.
